result.execSummary:
The defendant Felipe Arguello-Callejas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-THC(>200-1000g), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms. Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.

miscConds.notes: Remain controlled substance and alcohol free; may not use, sell or be around controlled substances; urine screens.
Seek and maintain employment. Job and vocational training.

Pay $1,500.00 fine, plus DNA surcharge, costs, disbursements and supervision fees.  Failure to pay amounts in full by the end of probationary term would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant which is non-dischargable in bankruptcy.  Court ordered monies held on inventory at the West Allis Police Department be applied to the fine, costs, surcharges and disbursements in this case.

Should defendant complete all conditions set forth by this Court, the Department of Corrections; pay all the fines, costs and surcharges; and remain free and clear of the criminal justice system arising to the level of probable cause or greater, the Court would consider a petition for expungement.

timeConds.notes: Serve 90 days at the House of Correction, with Huber for work; good time allowed.  Report date stayed to: 7/22/14 at 5:00 p.m. The 30 days balance remaining is to be stayed and used by agent for non-compliance.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Felipe Arguello-Callejas

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Addition to entry of 7/15/14: Court ordered monies held on inventory at the West Allis Police Department be applied to the fine, costs, surcharges and disbursements in this case.

Defendant Felipe Arguello-Callejas in court with attorney Stephen M Govin.  Dennis P Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Antonella Aleman.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 7/15/2014 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 15, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Felipe Arguello-Callejas in court with attorney Stephen M Govin.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel needs help opening disk of the defendant's statements.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 5/29/2014 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Felipe Arguello-Callejas in court with attorney Stephen M Govin.  Dennis Murphy for Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 6, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 04-24-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Felipe Arguello-Callejas in court with attorney Stephen M Govin.  Jacob D Corr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.vb
